page.title: 19Interviewing the Lord Mayor
page.content: On the 15th July three children from Plympton St Maurice Primary School went to the Lord Mayors Parlour to interview him. We interviewed him since he lives in Plympton and is the first Plympton Lord Mayor. He told us he was first elected a counciler 18 years ago, and after 15 years he was eligable to become Lord Mayor. The post of Lord Mayor alternates between the two main political parties. He said he had lived in Plympton for 25 years and owned two garages. The Lord Mayor mentioned that there had been a lot of factories built since employment was needed. He said Plympton had changed since the byepass was built, and hoped to see Plympton St Maurice traffic free and the Castle renovated. He wanted to see trees planted.{Lisa {Foster, Vicky Diamond, & Sally Barnes.
